page.title: 07MILLS
page.content: There are two mills in our area: Loders Mill and New Street Mill. Loders Mill was used as a flour mill until 1978 when the owner, H.Barnes, died.They had to build a man made river because the natural river was too low to run the wheel.New Street Mill now only runs on Wednesday. It was never used as a business mill, it has always been privately owned. It is owned by P.C. Tomkins. Loders Mill runs once a fortnight. When it was a business it ran every day. H.Barnes had his own fleet of heavy goods vehicles. The owners are now the Laskey family. The wheel is under cover and the only way to get to the wheel for maintenance is to go through a door in some panelling.The mill down New Street Lane runs off its own stream from Eggardon Hill. Loders Mill is 150 years old.
